column1: Telecaller and Lead Operator
column2: Apollo Tele health Services  is looking for Telecaller and Lead Operator  to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey  Lead Generation and Sales:      Conduct outbound calls to prospective customers to generate leads and promote products or services.      Follow up on leads generated through marketing campaigns, website inquiries, and other channels to qualify prospects and convert them into sales opportunities.      Achieve individual and team sales targets by effectively communicating product features, benefits, and pricing to potential customers.      Customer Service and Support:      Handle inbound calls from existing customers, providing assistance, resolving inquiries, and addressing concerns in a professional and timely manner.      Build rapport and establish positive relationships with customers to enhance satisfaction and loyalty.      Escalate complex issues or unresolved customer complaints to appropriate channels for resolution.      Team Leadership and Supervision:      Lead and supervise a team of telecallers, providing guidance, coaching, and performance feedback to drive productivity and results.      Monitor and evaluate team performance, including call quality, conversion rates, and adherence to scripts and protocols.      Conduct regular training sessions and workshops to enhance the skills and knowledge of team members.      Call Center Operations:      Ensure the smooth operation of the call center, including managing call queues, scheduling shifts, and optimizing staffing levels to meet service level agreements (SLAs).      Monitor call volumes, handle overflow calls during peak periods, and implement strategies to minimize wait times and maximize efficiency.      Maintain accurate records of calls, sales transactions, and customer interactions using CRM software or call center management systems.      Reporting and Analysis:      Generate reports and analyze call center metrics, including call volume, response times, and conversion rates, to identify trends, areas for improvement, and opportunities for optimization.      Provide regular updates and insights to management on team performance, sales trends, and customer feedback.

column1: Hiring Sr Manager-RCM & TL-RCM with UB04/EDHM/Hospital Billing
column2: HealthRecon Connect LLC provides technology-enabled Revenue Cycle Management (RCM) solutions to US healthcare providers. We leverage over 30 years of deep domain expertise, cutting-edge analytics as well as machine learning, Artificial Intelligence and Automated workflows to help improve cashflow, patient outcomes and enable peace of mind for our clients. At HealthRecon Connect (HRC), we hold ourselves accountable for setting and maintaining high standards. Day after day, we passionately strive for high achievement; for customer delight and thrive on the challenge of high expectations and commitment to excel. We are looking for team members with RCM experience  specifically in the area of  Hospital Emergency Department/Hospital Medicine   Team Lead    RCM Operations (Hospital Emergency Department/Hospital Medicine)/Hospital Billing/Institutional Billing/UB04 Role Profile Efficiently manage the throughput of a team (20+). Ensure the client requirements are delivered within TAT with the support of the functional leads. Execute necessary controls in place to ensure performance aligns with benchmarks. Rollout and implement change initiatives driven by the management. Develop a high-performance culture through continuous development initiatives. Provide functional performance updates on KRAs during the SOU meeting. Attend to team requirements and ensure timely resolutions. Maximum resources for the greater good of the organization  Person Profile Possess a professional background with a Bachelor's Degree and professional qualification. Minimum 5 years of RCM experience. Minimum 3 years Hospital AR (UB04) experience with specific exposure to Hospital Emergency Department/Hospital Medicine Hands on experience in Cerner practice management system. Ability to perform contract calculations to determine low pay Proven expertise in Accounts Receivables management in RCM. Proven expertise in multiple client specialities and practice management systems. Proven expertise in managing teams and being responsible for the team KPI delivery.  Proficiency in the use of MS Office tools  Ability to function well in a fast-paced pressurized work environment.   Senior Manager Operations  Hospital Emergency Department/Hospital Medicine (ED/HM)/Hospital Billing/Institutional Billing/UB04 Role Profile Independently manage and be responsible for  Hospital ED/HM vertical: managing operational excellence, client relationships and team management  Function as primary point of contact for the clients under purview and help streamline business operations Monitor performance metrics proactively to maintain standards in delivery, prevent issues and take swift corrective action as needed Manage client information, periodic updates and management information as agreed  Monitor team performance and productivity to identify training needs, performance gaps and address them accordingly  Work closely with QA department to drive accuracy targets. Create action plans for identified gaps  Solve complex customer service issues by proactively identifying and eliminating root cause barriers to accuracy, productivity, and quality.  Ensure operations are in line with the HRC Compliance framework requirements Review processes, provide feedback and identify areas of improvements as necessary Lead location efforts in automation and other solution roll-outs according to company timelines  Work closely with global leadership in establishing the company Values framework in the location  Person Profile Possess a professional background with a Bachelor's Degree / professional qualification  At least 10 years of total experience of which at least 7 years at people management At least 07 years of Hospital RCM domain knowledge with responsibility within ED/HM domain  Demonstrated experience in being responsible for large groups of employees in a complex operational setting Proven expertise is working across geographical locations, within KPI, SLA driven environment Strong executive presence, including communication skills that enable appreciate of others perspectives and the ability to offer compelling insights and recommendations Strong analytical capacity Excellent oral and written communication skills and be able to communicate effectively with all levels of management True change agent able to lead diverse groups in implementing new programs and ideas.   Work Week: Monday to Friday   Shift: Night: 7:30 PM  4:00 AM   Other Features: Full-time US calendar applicable   Please send us your CV to careers@healthreconconnect.com with the subject line ??eam Lead - Operations??HealthRecon Connect is an equal opportunity employer.

column1: R1-RCM Walk in Drive_AR Follow UP/AR Callers
column2: R1 RCM India is proud to be a Great Place To Work Certified organization which clearly states the culture and employee centric approach. Great Place To Work (GPTW) partners with more than 11,000 organizations annually across over 22 industries and assesses organizations through an employee survey on key parameters such as trust, pride, camaraderie, and fairness; and this certification puts us in the league of leading organizations for great workplace culture.   R1 is the leading provider of technology-driven solutions that transform the patient experience  and financial performance of hospitals, health systems and medical groups. We are the one company that combines the deep expertise of a global workforce of revenue  cycle professionals with the industrys most advanced technology platform, encompassing  sophisticated analytics, AI, intelligent automation, and workflow orchestration. We are committed to transform the healthcare industry with our innovative revenue cycle management services. Our goal is to make healthcare simpler and enable efficiency for healthcare systems, hospitals, and physician practices. With over 30,000 employees globally, we are about 14,000 strong in India with offices in Delhi NCR, Hyderabad, Bangalore, and Chennai. Our inclusive culture ensures that every employee feels valued, respected, and appreciated with a robust set of employee benefits and engagement activities. Interview Mode : Face-to-Face Interview Walk-in Days : Monday to Friday Walk in Timings : 1:00 PM to 5:00 PM Walk in Address:  Candor Tech Space Tower no. 3, 6th Floor, Plot 20 & 21, Sector 135, Noida, Uttar Pradesh 201304 Contact Person:  Talent Acquistion Team Noida 9289544594 Job Description: Follow up with the payer to check on claim status. Possess good knowledge of HIPPA, CPT codes, ICD9/10, Appeals, denial management. Exposure in denial management. Responsible for calling insurance companies in USA on behalf of doctors/physicians and follow up on outstanding accounts receivables. Identify denial reason and work on resolution. Save claim from getting written off by timely following up. Candidates must be comfortable with calling on denied claims. Note- Only Candidates with relevant experience in AR Follow up in US Healthcare can apply. Desired candidate profile: Candidate must possess good communication skills. AR RCM experience of atleast 12 months is mandatory Must be comfortable working in 24/7 work environment. Candidates must be comfortable with calling on denied claims. Benefits and Amenities: 5 days working Apart from development, and engagement programs, R1 offers transportation      facility to all its employees. There is specific focus on female security who work round-the-clock, be it inoffice premises or transport/ cab services. There is 24x7 medical support available at all office locations and R1 provides Mediclaim insurance for you and your dependents. All R1 employees are covered under term-life insurance and personal accidental insurance. R1 is a great workplace for women, and we strongly believe in being an equal opportunity organization. We provide maternity and paternity leaves as per the law and provide day-care facility for female employees.

column1: Senior Quality Officer / Quality Analyst
column2: If you are passionate about quality, have an eye for detail, and are dedicated to delivering exceptional customer service, we invite you to join our team. As a Quality Analyst for our Fulfillment / Service Desk, you will play a critical role in ensuring that our operations meet and exceed the highest standards of quality. You will be responsible for monitoring, evaluating, and providing feedback to our team members to improve overall performance and customer satisfaction. Key Responsibilities:   1.  Quality Monitoring : Regularly evaluate calls, chats, and emails to ensure adherence to established quality standards and processes.   2.  Feedback and Coaching : Provide constructive feedback to customer service representatives and support them in improving their performance.   3.  Performance Analysis : Analyze data and metrics to identify trends and areas for improvement, both at an individual and team level.   4.  Reporting : Create and maintain detailed reports on quality metrics and performance, and present findings to management.   5.  Process Improvement : Collaborate with team leads/managers/training team to develop and implement process improvements based on quality assessment results. column1: Inbound Sales Representative
column2: Be the spark that brightens days and ignite your career with TTECs award-winning employment experience. As an  Inbound Sales Representative  working onsite in Mumbai, Maharashtra, you??l be a part of bringing humanity to business. #experienceTTEC   Our employees have spoken. Our purpose, team, and company culture are amazing and our Great Place to Work? certification in India says it all!  Our recruitment hub is open for walk-in applicants from Monday to Friday, between 10:30 am and 4 pm IST. Visit TTEC Mumbai at 403 & 404, Nesco IT Park. If you're considering relocation, we also provide virtual interviews. What You??l be Doing Are you results focused and love to help others? Do you have a passion to maximize sales opportunities? In this role, you??l work effectively to service and upsell client products to existing customers or prospective inquiries. Focused on educating the customer on their current products or services, you??l also identify and capitalize on all other sale opportunities for products that may pair well with their current products and future needs. Whether it?? qualifying leads, resolving unique customer concerns, or fulfilling a need with a smile, you??l be the difference between their customer experience being just average or an exceptional one. During a Typical Day, You??l Bring your passion and product and brand knowledge to handle customer interactions, management objections and ultimately close the sale Effectively listen and ask pertinent questions to identify sales opportunity cues, recommend, quote and negotiate products or services that meet those customer needs Operate as a lead point of contact for all matters related to seller/customer portfolio and conduct deep dive analysis, develop and execute plans with existing sellers Publish key insights and action plans based on data What You Bring to the Role Applied sales experience with a customer focus mindset Impeccable spoken and written English language skills High school diploma or equivalent Computer experience What You Can Expect Supportive of your career and professional development An inclusive culture and community minded organization where giving back is encouraged A global team of curious lifelong learners guided by our company values Relocation assistance for those looking to move to Mumbai CTC between 30,000 to 45,000 INR per month subject to last drawn & prior experience And we have a healthy benefits package based on your position that could include paid time office, tuition reimbursement, health and wellness incentives, and so much more A Bit More About Your Role We??e committed to ensuring you have the skills and support to be successful in your role throughout your career. From your first day in training, through individualized webcam-enabled, engagement and coaching, on into 1000s of free courses to support your career growth wherever that may take you. And we know that you bring with you the one necessary ingredient that can?? be taught ??a caring and supportive nature that will shine through as you help customers. Our TTEC community is here for you as one dynamic, global family.  You'll report to the Team Lead. You'll contribute to the success of the customer experience and the overall success of the team.

column1: Call Centre Manager
column2: Position Overview:  We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Call Center Manager to oversee our customer service operations. The ideal candidate will possess exceptional communication skills, a strong aptitude for managing audits, and a passion for delivering outstanding customer service. As the Call Center Manager, you will play a pivotal role in ensuring the efficiency, productivity, and overall success of our call center team.  Job Location: Dadar  Team Leadership and Management:  Lead, mentor, and motivate a team of customer service representatives to achieve performance targets and deliver exceptional service.  Conduct regular performance evaluations, provide constructive feedback, and implement strategies for continuous improvement. 2. Audits and Quality Assurance:  Develop and implement audit processes to monitor the quality of customer interactions and ensure compliance with company standards and policies.  Analyze audit results, identify areas for improvement, and implement corrective actions as necessary. 3. Communication and Collaboration:  Foster open communication and collaboration within the call center team and with other departments to enhance efficiency and resolve customer issues effectively.  Serve as a liaison between frontline staff and upper management, providing regular updates on performance, challenges, and opportunities. 4. Customer Service Excellence:  Uphold a customer-centric approach and drive a culture of excellence in customer service delivery.  Handle escalated customer inquiries and complaints with professionalism and empathy, striving for swift resolution and customer satisfaction. 5. Operational Efficiency:  Develop and optimize call center workflows, processes, and procedures to maximize efficiency and productivity.  Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs), such as call volume, response times, and customer satisfaction scores, and take proactive measures to address any issues. This role is for inbound process and the call center,  Timings:10 am to 6 pm   Working Days: Monday to Saturday  IF INTERESTED, EMAIL US YOUR CV on Bhargesh.jani@zhl.in or message your CV on 9082267782

column2: Job Opportunity: Salesforce Administrator (Specialist, FAO)   Location:  Bangalore, India  Employment Type:  Full-time  Shift : Night Shift Are you a talented Salesforce Administrator seeking an exciting opportunity in Bangalore? Join our client's team as a Salesforce Admin Specialist and play a pivotal role in driving business capabilities through effective Salesforce implementation and support. Role and Key Responsibilities: Act as the primary point of contact for functional and technical support, collaborating with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and design business capabilities. Analyze data and operational processes to identify insights for improvement and solve complex problems. Use Agile Scrum methodologies to create and maintain documentation of key artifacts, processes, and system functionality. Design, implement, and integrate software modifications and enhancements. Develop technical requirements and provide input during the development stage to align with customer business needs. Communicate the business impacts of system and data changes to stakeholders. Participate in the analysis, testing, and deployment of changes to third-party integrated systems. Assist in creating scripts for user acceptance testing (UAT) and ensure new functionality is accurately documented and reflected in training materials. Successfully manage project deliverables from initiation to closure and provide recommendations for process improvements. Key Skills and Knowledge: Strong interpersonal, collaboration, and communication skills. Experience in consulting or with consulting organizations is highly desirable. Hands-on experience in large-scale global Salesforce implementations, particularly in Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, Communities, or Custom Cloud. Bachelor's degree in information systems or a related field, or equivalent business experience. Salesforce Administrator Certification is preferred. 3+ years of Salesforce configuration and administration experience. Previous experience as a business systems analyst or equivalent role in complex application development projects. Proficiency in Agile methodologies and working in an Agile IT team. Customer support experience for accounting platforms (ERP functional support) at L1/L2 levels. Significant technical customer support experience, preferably with international clients.

column1: Hiring Immediately For Pre-Auth Specialist at Triarq Health
column2: TRIARQ Health  is a Physician Practice Services company that partners with doctors to run modern patient- centered practices so they can be rewarded for delivering high-value care. TRIARQs Physician-led partnerships simplify practices transition to value-based care by combining our proprietary, cloud-based practice, care management platform and patient engagement services to help doctors focus on better outcomes. Industry Type: RCM / US Medical Billing Location: Navi Mumbai (Ghansoli) Division: Revenue Cycle Management (RCM) Job Responsibilities:  This is a full-time work from office role for a Pre-authorization Specialist. The Pre-authorization Specialist will be responsible for verifying patient insurance coverage, obtaining pre-authorization for medical procedures prior to services being rendered utilizing online websites, tools, or via phone calls. The Pre-authorization Specialist will communicate with insurance companies and healthcare providers to resolve any issues or discrepancies in claims. The Pre-authorization Specialist needs to be able to review and understand Provider Medical Records. The Pre-authorization Specialist needs to be able to submit Appeals for denied claims and ensure all accurate and pertinent information is provided to the Payer in a timely manner. Skills Required:  1-2 years experience in the Pre-Auth department.  Experience with medical billing and insurance verification and authorization processes.  Strong communication and interpersonal skills to interact with insurance companies.  Attention to detail and ability to accurately process and manage data.  Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and meet deadlines.  Good understanding of medical terminology.  Good understanding of Payer guidelines. Education: Graduate (Any stream). Employment Type: Full Time, Permanent. Night shift. Perks and benefits: Home Drop Facility, Free Dinner Facility, 5 days working (Monday to Friday), Performance based incentives. column1: BPO Executive (International Voice Process)
column2: Job Description: As a BPO Executive, you will be responsible for providing excellent customer service to our international clients through voice interactions. You will handle a variety of inquiries, resolve customer issues, and ensure a positive customer experience. This role requires effective communication skills, a customer-centric approach, and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment. Responsibilities: Handle inbound calls from international customers professionally and efficiently. Address customer inquiries, resolve complaints, and provide appropriate solutions in a timely manner. Maintain up-to-date knowledge of company products/services to effectively assist customers. Adhere to quality and productivity standards while meeting performance targets. Document all customer interactions accurately and comprehensively in the CRM system. Collaborate with team members and other departments to ensure seamless customer service delivery. Requirements: Minimum 0.8 months of experience in international voice calling. Excellent communication skills in English (both verbal and written). Ability to empathize with customers and demonstrate strong problem-solving skills. Flexibility to work in rotational shifts, including nights and weekends. Benefits: Competitive salary commensurate with experience. Attractive incentives and performance-based bonuses. Comprehensive training and career development opportunities. Health insurance and other employee benefits. Dynamic and inclusive work culture with opportunities for advancement. How to Apply: If you meet the above requirements and are eager to be part of a dynamic team, please do reach us on 8099089247(Solomon) or solomon.ganjeti@motivitylabs.com. We look forward to hearing from you! Work Location: Hyderabad

column2: NOTE: Please Mention "Sivapriya" as reference in the resume, While coming for the Interview.   Roles & Responsibilities: Responsible for handling calls and chat and providing customer support, Identify and relate with various customer needs and scenarios, Conduct issue identification and problem-solving meeting customer needs and satisfaction, Provide customers with cutting-edge service in a friendly, confident, and knowledgeable manner either through Calls or Chats, Remain updated in client and internal processes, technology applications, utilities, and products, Utilize various internal and client-based tools and applications for customer management and servicing, Conduct data entry, documentation, and case management, Work and partner with others within a team-based environment, Achieve and maintain required metrics and goals, Adhere to company policies and procedures as described on the HR Handbook,   Good understanding of phone/chat etiquette -  Not interrupting, abstains from making unpleasant vocal gestures, etc.  Ability to establish call control/multi-task chat queries, Ability to use logical and non-linear troubleshooting techniques to resolve the root cause of a problem.    Written Skills:  Ability to compose grammatically precise, concise, and appropriate sentences, Ability to clearly understand and respond appropriately to the problem statements of customers, Verbal Skills:  Ability to articulate, clear and friendly tone in a neutral accent without dead air, Ability to manage and maintain required communication pace, Knowledge of browsers (MS Internet Explorer, Mozilla Firefox, Google Chrome), Capable of consistently managing a higher level of professional, yet courteous communication standards (Verbal & Written), Capable of managing communication flow and direction, Effective time management and should have strong focus on schedule adherence and/or attendance based on previous employment/school records, Goal orientated with a focus on learning and continuous improvement, Team player that is willing to make adaptions for the benefit of customers and the program's engagement activities, Ability to Type 35+ WPM with accuracy of 85%. For Further details Contact, Sivapriya-9445358584 Talent Aquisition

column2: Hi ,  " Greetings From HSBS Team " We are hiring for Customer voice /non Voice process for Bangalore /Hyderabad location  Company Name : HSBS (  You will be permanent & Payroll with HSBC )  What we will offer you A competitive base salary and discretionary bonus scheme Various HSBC leave policies that allow you to rest, recuperate and balance personal and family commitments Market-leading training and development program leading to excellent Career Progression opportunities Preferential staff banking offers for all Permanent and Contract Employees Attractive benefit package such as medical insurance, housing loan and share options 5-day working shift pattern - 8 hour shift with an hour break time Transportation allowance as per shift eligibility An onsite Cafeteria catering to multiple cuisines, confectionery store, fruit juice counter Opportunity to get involved in social and sports activities Rewards and Recognition for your success and contribution to the team Great team environment   In this role you will be: Working in a contact center environment handling multiple customer queries from our Customers typically on multiple products and or propositions Providing quality customer service over the phone to resolve customer enquiries at a high level of customer satisfaction Ability to interpret and handle complex customer enquiries to establish their needs and offer relevant products, services and solutions Taking ownership and initiative to complete necessary research and customer follow up or direct the customer to the appropriate department for resolution Responsible for achieving individual key performance indicators and development whilst maintaining appropriate operational risk control and compliance in all activities Advising, communicating, empathizing, resolving conflict and responding sensitively to clients Responsible for ensuring resolution in a timely manner, while maintaining the highest level of quality support in every customer interaction Recognize and adjust support approach to accommodate all levels of customers experience Communicate positively with team members, customers, and other partners

column1: Customer Support Executive/Voice
column2: EY is hiring for customer service role for one of its reputed client.   Location : Gurugram/Kolkata Profile : Customer Support Employment Type: Full-Time Term: 12 months (Renewable) Shifts: EMEA (12:30 pm - 9:30 pm) Company Overview:  EY is a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction, and advisory services. We aim to build a better working world by helping businesses solve their toughest challenges, grow, and thrive. Join us in Gurugram, Haryana, as we embark on a journey of innovation and excellence. Job Description:  We are currently seeking a dedicated customer support executive/analyst for one of our global telecommunication client to join our team in Gurugram and Kolkata. The successful candidate will be responsible for handling international customer inquiries and issues through voice calls and online front-end operations. Additionally, they will identify and integrate upselling opportunities, adapt sales pitches based on customer responses, and prioritize customer satisfaction. Key Responsibilities:  - Handle international customer inquiries and issues through voice calls with precision and professionalism. - Manage online front-end operations to ensure smooth customer interactions. - Identify and integrate upselling opportunities into customer interactions. - Adapt sales pitches based on customer responses and needs. - Prioritize customer satisfaction and promptly resolve any issues or concerns. Key Requirements:  - Bachelor's degree in any discipline. - 2-12 months of experience in a customer service role, preferably in an international voice process. - Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English, with a neutral accent. - Strong problem-solving and interpersonal skills. - Ability to work flexible hours. Perks & Benefits:  - Transport facility available as per the clients policy. - Meals provided as per the clients policy. - Opportunity to work with a dynamic and global team. - Career growth and development opportunities within the organization. How to Apply:  If you are interested in this exciting opportunity, please submit your resume/CV to rakhi.sharma1@in.ey.com. Please mention your current and expected salary in the email subject line. Note:   Kolkata CTC - upto 2.6 LPA  Gurugram CTC - Upto 4 LPA Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for further evaluation. Join us at EY and be part of a collaborative team dedicated to making a positive impact on businesses and communities worldwide.

column1: Calling Agent (International BPO)
column2: We are seeking a motivated and energetic Tele Sales Representative to join our team for the night shift. The primary responsibility of this role is to make outbound calls to potential customers, introduce our products/services, and persuade them to make a purchase or set up appointments for our sales team. The ideal candidate should have excellent communication skills, a persuasive personality, and the ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment. Role: Calling Agent Location: Lower Parel Shift: Night Shift (US Process) Responsibilities: Conduct outbound calls to prospective customers using provided leads or database. Introduce company products/services to potential customers and explain their benefits. Persuade customers to make a purchase or set up appointments for our sales team. Follow up on leads generated by marketing campaigns or other sources. Maintain a high level of professionalism and customer service in all interactions. Meet or exceed daily, weekly, and monthly sales targets. Adhere to company policies and procedures at all times. Perform other duties as assigned by the supervisor or management. Requirements: Proven experience in tele sales or telemarketing, preferably in a night shift role. Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written. Strong persuasive and negotiation skills. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Goal-oriented with a focus on achieving sales targets. Ability to handle objections and rejection professionally. Compensation as per experience.

column2: Job Description: Customer Service Representative (Kannada Inbound Voice Process) Responsibilities: Promptly and professionally respond to customer inquiries via phone, email, and chat, ensuring accurate and timely information is provided in both Kannada and English languages. Efficiently process customer orders, manage delivery schedules, and coordinate with our logistics team to ensure the timely delivery of water cans. Handle customer complaints and concerns in a professional manner, diligently working to resolve issues and provide satisfactory solutions, while maintaining a positive and empathetic attitude. Maintain a comprehensive understanding of Bookwater products, services, and technology to effectively address customer inquiries and concerns, providing clear and concise explanations in Kannada and English. Collaborate with other departments to address customer needs and continuously improve the overall customer experience, sharing feedback and insights to drive service enhancements. Monitor and analyze customer feedback to identify trends and areas for improvement, contributing to the enhancement of our services and processes. Assist in the development and implementation of customer service policies and procedures to ensure consistency and excellence in our service delivery, adhering to company guidelines and industry best practices. Actively participate in ongoing training and development opportunities to stay updated with industry best practices and enhance job performance, demonstrating a commitment to continuous learning and improvement. Contribute to a positive and inclusive work environment by fostering a culture of teamwork and collaboration, supporting colleagues and promoting a sense of belonging and mutual respect. Qualifications: Graduation is mandatory. Excellent communication skills in both Kannada and English languages, with the ability to articulate information clearly and effectively.

column1: Customer Support|International voice|BFSI| Fresher/Experience|Sal-4.50
column2: Job Title: International Voice Customer Support Representative Job Description: We are seeking a motivated and customer-centric individual to join our team as an International Voice Customer Support Representative. In this role, you will be responsible for assisting customers from around the world with their inquiries, concerns, and technical issues. The ideal candidate will have excellent communication skills, a passion for customer service, and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment. Reach Mrityunjay Chakraborthy at - 9972832623 Email - mrityunjay@thejobfactory.co.in Work Location:  DLF newtown, Kolkata. Responsibilities: Provide exceptional customer service to international customers via phone calls. Answer inquiries and resolve issues regarding products, services, billing, and technical support. Troubleshoot technical problems and provide step-by-step solutions to customers. Document all customer interactions accurately and thoroughly in the company's database. Collaborate with other departments to ensure timely resolution of customer issues. Identify opportunities to upsell or cross-sell products and services to customers. Stay up-to-date on product knowledge and company policies to effectively assist customers. Requirements: Any Graduate/ Undergraduate. Previous experience in customer service or Banking support preferred. Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, in English (additional language skills are a plus). Ability to empathize with customers and provide solutions in a courteous and professional manner. Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail. Proficiency in using customer service software and basic computer applications. Willingness to work flexible hours, including evenings, weekends, and holidays, as needed. Benefits: Competitive salary based on experience - Upto 4.75 LPA Health insurance and other benefits package. Opportunities for career growth and advancement. Friendly and supportive work environment. Training and development programs to enhance skills. Reach Mrityunjay Chakraborthy at - 9972832623 Email - mrityunjay@thejobfactory.co.in If you are passionate about providing exceptional customer service and enjoy working with people from diverse backgrounds, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity!

column1: Customer Service
column2: At [ GLOBIVA ], we count on the customer service department to interact professionally with our valued customers when they have questions or concerns. Were looking for a highly skilled customer service representative to join our team and handle inbound and outbound phone calls, email requests, and face-to-face interactions using a friendly, helpful approach. The ideal candidate is a quick learner who can think on their feet and resolve any issues with a customer-first business mentality. This person should also have experience in sales, as the opportunity may arise to promote company products and services. The most successful customer service representative will have the communication and interpersonal skills needed to provide support, answer questions, and resolve issues in an efficient manner. Serving as the voice and face of our company, the representative will be integral in reinforcing our reputation for exceptional customer service. Objectives of this role Manage a large volume of inbound and outbound calls, emails, and chats with knowledge and efficiency Identify and address customer needs, with a goal of total satisfaction Provide expert answers to questions about products, pricing, and availability while presenting the value of our product portfolio to customers Meet customer-service department sales targets, generating leads when opportunities arise Follow company guidelines and procedures for communications with minimal supervision Recommend improvements to company processes for efficiency Responsibilities Build expert, dynamic knowledge of the companys products and services Conduct research with available resources to satisfy customer inquiries Engage with customers in an inviting, friendly, and professional manner to deliver exceptional experiences and nurture lasting relationships Respond quickly, professionally, and accurately to customer inquiries regarding quotes, orders, status, complaints, returns, and warranties Meet personal/team qualitative and quantitative targets by explaining the benefits of additional products and services to customers and seizing opportunities to sell Maintain daily recordings and documentation of issues and resolutions in a database for sales and executive management teams to review Required skills and qualifications High school diploma or equivalent Successful experience in a corporate environment Strong communication skills, including active listening and clear articulation Ability to solve problems, alleviate conflicts, and escalate tactfully Ability to multitask, manage time, and prioritize Ability to work individually and as a team member Preferred skills and qualifications Experience in sales Experience in a call-center environment Proven track record of meeting or exceeding sales quotas

column1: Telecaller Real Estate
column2: Job description : Real Estate Sales the the Role & Responsibilities: Must generate leads by calling and contacting the prospects and convince channel partners / clients to visit the portal before subscription. Will be responsible for lead generation or site visits from given leads of residential-luxury properties. Meeting Weekly and Monthly Targets in Site visits. On-boarding of clients and servicing of existing ones on the platform. Handling Inbound and Outbound calls. Following up with Leads provided from various marketing campaigns and associations. Maintaining database of clients in Software, following up with them on regular basis. Responding to SMS & WhatsApp calls. Arranging and coordinating the meetings between client and sales team. Preferred candidate profile Senior Pre-Sales candidate, to guide and monitor juniors in the team. A Handful of Experience in calling and convincing prospects and converting into leads. Inter-departmental coordination. Possessing a sharp eye for detail on the lead follow-up. Good knowledge of MS Office. Good communication skills. A quick learner who is adaptable. Ability to build strong customer relationships. Perks and benefits: Salary is no bar for deserving candidates + Good incentives on lead generation.

column1: Customer Care Executive
column2: Role & responsibilities: To remain as basic point of contact for customers with queries, complaints, feedback, requests etc. Ensuring timely and professional responses to all complaints, requests and queries received. Research and compilation of answers for informational requests from customers. Proper recording and scrutiny of the complaints received. Efficient dealing of complaints to completion and enabling satisfaction of customer. Rendering useful administrative support to other members of the customer care team. Preferred candidate profile: A deep knowledge of the operations of a customer care department in an organization. Outstanding communication (written and oral) and interpersonal skills enabling one to deal with internal and external customer support professionally. Creative problem-solving skills. Capacity to work both as an individual and as a team. Excellent organizational and time management ability. Highly self-motivated, willing to learn and quick adaptation to new processes within less time frame. Basic computer knowledge with MS-Office, and effective browsing skills.

column1: Customer Support Executive
column2: Role Summary: Raise is built on this core philosophy - we will bring exceptionally great products, awesome user experience and best in class customer service to our users. We have started with our first step by launching Investment & Trading platform  Dhan (www.dhan.co) As a part of the Customer Support team with Raise, you understand that it is your responsibility to drive customer satisfaction. You will work very closely with internal stakeholders, your team members in customer support team, management and most importantly our customers. You will display empathy with customers in all conversations, ensure you hear them well, and share with them the appropriate resolution (to the point) and if not now, get back to them at the earliest. We are building Raise to deliver an awesome customer experience  and your role is critical for us to deliver that promise. If you are someone who is passionate about Financial Services and Fintech products in India wherein you feel the clients / customers should get the best possible experience, then you are looking at the place where you should apply. This would require you to be excited about the business and work with all stakeholders to drive excellence.  Expected Responsibilities: To handle and resolve customer queries is your primary responsibility at the same time you will adhere to the quality standards for customer service. Make every effort to raise the bar in every interaction. Other than that: To maintain a positive, empathetic, and professional attitude toward customers at all times. Learn and get formally trained on the product in entirety so that one is able to respond rightly and promptly to the questions. Take customer feedback across various touch points. You will be part of other channels like Voice, Email, Chat, etc from time to time. Communicating and coordinating with Team Leaders as necessary and know when to efficiently escalate and resolve matters. Keeping records of customer interactions, transactions, comments, and complaints. To approach internal stakeholders for feedback on customer service quality and process, while also build sustainable relationship, trust with them through open communication. Expected Skills: We are a start-up and we are focusing on fast growth with quality products hence the ability to work in a fast-paced environment goes without saying. Other than that:  Graduation from any field is a must.  0-2 years of experience. Freshers straight out of college / university. Experienced folks from airlines, hospitality, other customer facing industry will also be preferred.  Self-starter, high on initiative and good confidence level to start things from scratch  Excellent communication  both verbal and written that are needed for communicating with a range of people both internally and externally is a must have  Strong interpersonal skills for building and developing professional relationships This is an on-site opportunity. Our office is at Borivali (East), Mumbai. Mumbai (western suburb line) candidates would be preferred.  Email your resume to: rekha.parmar@dhan.co and ruchi.singh@dhan.co

column1: International Voice Process Executive
column2: About Client One of the largest global banking and financial services organization catering to 40 million customers with offices in 63 countries. Their customers base spans from individual savers and investors to some of the worlds biggest companies and government. Job Description As a Customer Service Executive, you will be responsible for providing exceptional customer service and support to clients or customers. Your primary objective will be to ensure customer satisfaction, resolve queries, and maintain a positive image of the company. Provides high quality service to achieve maximum customer satisfaction by resolving the customer query at first contact where possible. Takes ownership and initiative to complete necessary research and customer follow up or direct the customer to the appropriate department for resolution. Required Skills  Excellent communication skills (verbal and written) Empathy and patience when dealing with customers. Understanding on CSAT and FCR (Customer satisfaction survey & First call resolution) Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work in a team. Ability to multitask and prioritize in a fast-paced environment. Previous experience in a customer service role is beneficial but not mandatory. Qualifications Bachelor's degree / Undergraduate (10+2) with minimum 6 month of work experience is preferred. Flexible to work in 24/7 shifts.

column2: Dear Candidate,   Job Title:  International Voice Process Executive (Banking Experience in BPO Preferred)     Location:  Indore Job Description:  We are seeking dynamic individuals with a proven track record in international voice process, particularly in the banking sector, to join our team as International Voice Process Executives. As a crucial part of our customer support team, you will be responsible for providing exceptional service to our international clientele, utilizing your expertise in both voice process operations and banking services.   Key Responsibilities: Handle inbound and outbound calls in a professional manner, addressing customer inquiries and resolving issues promptly. Utilize your banking industry knowledge to assist customers with account-related queries, transaction issues, and other banking services. Collaborate effectively with team members and other departments to achieve collective goals and targets.   Requirements: Need minimum 12th pass.  At least 1 Year experience of voice in an international BPO is required. Proven experience in international voice process, preferably in the banking sector In BPO. Excellent communication skills in English both verbal and Written. Ability to multitask, prioritize, and manage time effectively in a fast-paced environment. Customer-centric mindset with a passion for delivering exceptional service. Flexibility to work in rotational shifts, including weekends and holidays. Must be okay with night shifts.  Perks and Benefits: Competitive salary package UPTO 6LPA with performance-based incentives. Salary completely depends on last draw CTC as 30% hike on last salary will be provided. Comprehensive training and career development opportunities. Health insurance and other benefits as per company policy. Vibrant and inclusive work culture with opportunities for growth and advancement. Both side cabs in odd hours. Else one side Cab and other side cab reimbursement of 2K per month. Relocation amount will be provided. If you have a passion for customer service and possess the necessary skills and experience, we would love to hear from you. Join us in shaping the future of international banking voice support! Notes-  Immediate joiner  For getting your interview scheduled, you can connect with below HR SPOC. HR Keshav  - 7703891018  Keshav@peoplestaff.in

column1: Sales Strategist (International voice/sales Process)
column2: At Regalix, now A Market star Company, you will have the opportunity to work in a dynamic environment that thrives on collaboration, embraces cutting-edge technologies, and delivers impactful solutions to our clients. With a shared commitment to excellence, innovation, and client success, we are setting new benchmarks in the market. By leveraging Regalix's deep understanding of digital marketing strategies and Marketstar's proven track record in driving sales and customer engagement, we have forged a unique synergy that propels us to the forefront of our field. Together, we will shape the future of our industry and achieve new heights of success. Sales   Strategist Experience:  0 to 5 years Location:  Hyderabad Salary:  Based on Industry Standards Educational   Qualifications   :   Fresher(Graduate in any stream)  Undergraduate with international voice calling experience  What if you had the chance to work with some of the most iconic brands of our generation? What if your work helped drive real business outcomes for the clients that you work with? With our eyes set on the future, we are looking for an energetic, outcome-oriented Sales Strategist to join our team of experts in Hyderabad. As a Sales Strategist, you will be working with a food delivery expert across the US ( synonymous with   Swiggy   and   Zomato   in   India ), looking to onboard new merchants on their platform to increase market penetration. Read on to understand more about this opportunity. Who   are   we   looking   for? We are looking for a motivated sales strategist with an entrepreneurial and building spirit to join our team! You'll be instrumental in helping to onboard new merchants, and drive business revenue all while having a blast doing it! Domain experience required (but not restricted to) - Travel, Entertainment, Insurance/Mortgage  (International   ONLY) , IT Hardware, Hotel Room Sales/F&B Sales  (International   ONLY). What   of   work   will   you   be   doing? Outbound Sales Create sales strategies that can drive higher revenues Pipeline Management Negotiation Objection-Handling Time Management and Planning What   you   will   need   to   succeed?  Exceptional written & verbal communication skills  Logical Reasoning Ability to multitask Presentation skills Fresher   to   5   years   of   work   experience   Work   from   Hyderabad Flexible   to   shifts  Interested candidates can share their updated resumes   On the  email  (farheen.hussain@regalix-inc.com ) HR Farheen Hussain  Contact No:- 8904046040(Text messages only)

column1: Customer Support Executive - CTPL
column2: Job Description: We are seeking a proactive and customer-oriented individual to join our team as a Customer Service Executive. The ideal candidate will be responsible for providing exceptional service to our clients and ensuring their satisfaction with our products and services. As a Customer Service Executive, you will be the primary point of contact for resolving customer inquiries, issues, and complaints through various channels including phone, email, and live chat. Key Responsibilities: Responding promptly to customer inquiries and resolving issues efficiently. Providing information about products, services, and company policies to customers. Handling and resolving customer complaints in a professional manner. Processing orders, returns, and exchanges accurately and efficiently. Keeping accurate records of customer interactions and transactions. Collaborating with other departments to ensure timely resolution of customer issues. Identifying and implementing process improvements to enhance the customer experience. Staying up-to-date with product knowledge and industry trends. Requirements: Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience. Proven experience in customer service or a related field. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Strong problem-solving abilities and attention to detail. Ability to multitask and work efficiently in a fast-paced environment. Proficiency in MS Office and customer service software. Ability to remain calm and professional under pressure.

column1: Hiring For Customer Support @Coimbatore
column2: Avantor is looking for an associate for entry level position who answers routine questions and issues from external or internal customers. Frequently escalates more complex customer complaints or issues to more senior customer service representatives. What were looking for   Education:  Undergraduate, Graduate, Diploma or Equivalent Work Experience required. Experience:  0-8 years of Customer Service experience preferred. Preferred   Qualifications:    Must demonstrate working knowledge of personal computer applications, such as      Microsoft Word, Excel, Access and Outlook. Excellent customer service skills (friendly, courteous and helpful). Excellent communication skills (grammar, voice, diction). Strong customer orientation. Ability to evaluate customer needs, and respond with appropriate action/delivery. How you will thrive and create an impact    Primary contact with customers by email/fax/chat/phone concerning orders, returns, shipments and products. Receive and enter phone, fax, email and chat orders. Call/Email customers when necessary to advise shipments delay and/or information      necessary to process orders. Make changes to or cancel orders/backorders and notify customers as required. Initiate orders for replacement parts and/or for correcting errors (shortages, wrong item      shipped, etc.). Initiate file maintenance for corrections to customer file. Complete/route appropriate internal documentation to initiate processes to fulfill customer order(s). Manage order entry database as required to satisfy customer requests. Generate reports      from database as per business needs. Work closely with internal departments and/or manufacturer to assure commitment to      customer is met in a timely manner. Solicit sale of new or additional services. Handle irate customers in a professional manner. Obtain customer feedback information and provide timely feedback to company regarding      service failures or customer concerns. Initiating shipment tracers with carriers. Performs other duties as assigned.

column1: Call Center Executive
column2: Role & responsibilities    To remain well-groomed as per company policy. ??Handling telephonic inquiries of the patients and keeping a record of the same. ??Booking new and follow-up appointments of the patients online and directly in Palash ??Calling patients, who missed their first and follow-up appointments for the next appointment and reason for missing the same. ??Greeting and welcoming the patients/guests/consultants both voice and face-to-face. ??Assisting patients to fill-up the registration form and then registering patients in Palash ??Collecting payments and generating receipts for the patients. ??Preparing patients file (IVF files + Lab reports + SA report) for the next day appointments and informing same to consultants. ??Retrieving lab reports from the lab at regular interval and arranging the same in the alphabetical order. ??Following the patient flow as per standards and coordinating the same with other roles in the center. ??Scheduling appointments of the patients in a way which helps in minimizing patient waiting time in the system. ??Managing the patients waiting time in peak hours ??Managing the clinic ambience and display (Sound/Sight/Smell & Display on television, brochures, standee, and notices) ??Encouraging patients to fill up the OPD patient feedback forms and collecting the same from the patients. ??Obtaining and entering new patient demographics ??Reviewing all forms for accuracy and completion according to Canter policies prior to accepting ??Billing for the patients and closure of account on daily basis before leaving. ??Collecting feedback forms from the patients and documenting the same. End of the day preparing and analyzing reports to manager (feedback and other reports). ??Appointment booking and follow ups for OPD patients. ??Rescheduling of the OPD appointments. ??Daily reports sending it to all concern department.

column1: Inbound Executive
column2: About the Company     SolarSquare is India's most trusted and fastest growing residential & commercial solar company.   Our aim is to simplify solar for families looking to make the switch. We are a D2C residential solar brand - we design, install and finance rooftop solar systems for homes across India.   We are reimagining Home Energy with our rooftop solar solutions. We want to raise the bar for the industry and become Indias #1 new age solar brand.   Join us to become a part of the clean energy revolution of India, contribute to making SolarSquare India?? leading Home-Energy Brand and grow with us.  https://www.solarsquare.in/  Job description / Responsibilities -     Handling Incoming Calls : Manage and respond to incoming customer inquiries, providing information, resolving issues, or directing the call to the appropriate department.    Customer Support : Assist customers with product or service-related questions, troubleshoot problems, and provide guidance on usage.    Maintaining Records : Accurately log all customer interactions, notes, and details of inquiries for future reference and tracking purposes.    Problem Resolution : Effectively resolve customer complaints or concerns in a professional and timely manner, aiming for customer satisfaction.    Product Knowledge:  Develop a deep understanding of company products or services to assist customers more effectively.    Collaboration : Coordinate with other departments or teams to address complex customer issues or escalate concerns when necessary.  Qualifications :-    Communication Skills : Excellent verbal and written communication skills to interact with customers professionally and courteously.    Customer Service Orientation:  A strong focus on customer satisfaction, with the ability to empathize and resolve issues efficiently.    Problem-Solving Abilities : Capacity to analyze problems and provide solutions or escalate them  appropriately.    Experience Required: -  6 months ??2 years.

column1: Customer Care Executive
column2: ScribeEMR Systems is a technology-enabled remote live medical scribing, medical coding, and medical VA service company dedicated to improving the quality of physician documentation, physician-patient relationships, and achieving all the above while saving the time burden of the physician spent working with the EMR. We have a unique 'Start-Up' work environment, which allows for rapid and unlimited professional growth. Our head office is based out of Boston, MA, USA. We have 4 offices in India: Bengaluru, Coimbatore, Mohali, and Hyderabad. Learn more about us at  https://www.scribeemr.in/ 1.  Official   name   of   the   designation : Contact Center Support Agent, Voice. 2.  Reporting   location : Bengaluru 3.  Work   location : Office-based  4.  Work   timings : US dayshift i.e., Indian night shift, and shift time depends on the clients time zone in US. 5.  Qualifications   and   skillsets   needed: a. Any graduate who possesses at least 1 year of experience in an international call center,  specifically in voice processes. b. A science background is a plus. c. Prior experience in dealing with US healthcare clients. d. Customer-oriented attitude with professionalism. e. Strong multitasking, time management, and target achieving skills.  f. Exceptional telephone manner, customer service skills, active listening skills, verbal, and  written communication skills. g. Ability to resolve conflict and diffuse tension. h. Competency in necessary computer skills including Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, Internet,  and Excel. i. Good knowledge of CRM practices and systems. j. Capability to work independently and in collaboration with others to complete work and  meet deadlines with general supervision. k. Familiarity with medical coding is a plus. l. Flexible to work in any shifts. 6.  Essential   Duties   and   Responsibilities a. Handle large volume of inbound/outbound calls, voicemails/chats from patients,  healthcare providers, and other stakeholders, providing courteous and efficient service. b. Initiating outbound calls to patients for appointment reminders, follow-up consultations,  and other healthcare-related purposes. c. Conducting outbound calls to coordinate care, gather information, or provide support as  necessary. d. Assisting with administrative duties related to the process. e. Verify patient demographics, insurance information, and medical history accurately to  ensure data integrity. f. Identifying customers needs, clarify information, research every issue and providing solutions. g. Assess patient needs and concerns, escalating complex issues to appropriate healthcare  professionals for resolution. h. Follow up with patients to ensure satisfaction with services provided and address any  additional concerns or questions. i. Document all interactions and transactions accurately in the electronic health record  (EHR) system. j. Adhere to HIPAA regulations and maintain patient confidentiality at all times. k. Collaborate with other members of the healthcare team to facilitate coordination of care  and enhance the patients experience. l. Participate in ongoing training and professional development activities to stay updated  on industry trends and best practices. m. Adhere to customer service scripts and protocols provided by the client. n. Striving to achieve first call resolution and maintain the quality of service provided. o. Remaining calm and professional while dealing with angry customers and providing them  with the best solutions to resolve their issues. p. Build sustainable relationships and engage customers/callers by taking the extra mile. q. Responds to messages/tasks sent by the doctor/staff. r. Meet personal/team qualitative and quantitative targets. 7.  Reporting   hierarchy   (reporting   to   designation) : Contact Center Manager 8.  Compensation   offered : Rs. 37,000 per month CTC. 9.  Additional   Perks: a. Medical Insurance coverage for self, spouse, and a maximum of 2 children under 25 years of  age. This component cannot be reimbursed. b. Performance and attendance-based incentives up to Rs. 12000 based on process/complexity. c. Accident insurance worth 5 x annual CTC of the employee. 10.  How   to   apply : Apply through careers page of our website  https://www.scribeemr.in/careers NOTES : Please visit the following website to know more about us  www.scribeemr.in  If you still have any doubt, please write to  vmos@scribeemr.in

column1: Hiring AM - VOC & Customer Experience (Delhi)
column2: Hiring for AM - VOC & Customer Experience (Delhi)! Role & responsibilities  :   Customer Interaction: Respond      to customer inquiries via phone, email, or chat in a friendly, professional, and timely manner. Listen attentively to customer concerns and provide appropriate solutions or guidance. Offer information about products, services, and policies as required. Issue Resolution: Investigate and resolve customer complaints or issues effectively and efficiently. Use problem-solving skills to find satisfactory solutions, escalating complex cases when necessary. Document  customer interactions and issue resolutions in the company's CRM system. Product Knowledge: Develop a deep understanding of the company's products, services, and policies. Stay updated on product updates, pricing changes, and promotions to provide accurate information to customers. Communication: Communicate with other departments or teams to address customer concerns and provide      feedback on common issues. Maintain clear and concise communication with customers, ensuring they understand the resolution process. Customer Feedback: Solicit and record customer feedback to identify areas for improvement in products and services. Collaborate with management to develop strategies for enhancing the customer      experience. Customer Education: Proactively educate customers on self-service options and online resources to improve      their overall experience. Quality Assurance: Adhere to established quality assurance standards and guidelines in customer      interactions. Continuously work on improving customer satisfaction metrics. Documentation: Maintain accurate and up-to-date customer records, including contact information  and case details. Generate reports on customer service activities and performance as needed.

(Carry your CV and Aadhar Card for entry purpose)  Job Description:  iEnergizer is seeking enthusiastic and dedicated individuals to join our dynamic team as Inbound Customer Support Executives. As a Customer Support Executive, you will be responsible for providing exceptional service to our customers via inbound calls, addressing their queries, resolving issues, and ensuring overall customer satisfaction. Responsibilities: Handle inbound calls from customers with professionalism and empathy. Listen attentively to customer needs and provide appropriate solutions. Respond to customer inquiries regarding products, services, and general company information. Resolve customer complaints and escalate complex issues to the appropriate department if needed. Maintain a high level of customer satisfaction through effective communication and problem-solving skills. Keep accurate records of customer interactions and transactions. Requirements: Graduates  Excellent communication skills in English (both verbal and written). Ability to multitask, prioritize, and manage time effectively. Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail. Previous experience in customer service or call center environment is preferred but not required. Comprehensive training program to enhance your skills and knowledge. Opportunity for career growth and advancement within the company. Friendly work environment with supportive team members. 5 days working schedule to maintain a healthy work-life balance. If you are passionate about providing exceptional customer service and ready to embark on a rewarding career journey, we would love to hear from you! column1: Customer Service Representative - Financial Services - Voice
column2: Be the spark that brightens days and ignite your career with TTECs award-winning employment experience. As a  Customer Service Representative  Financial Services - Voice  working onsite in Mumbai, Maharashtra youll be a part of bringing humanity to business. #experienceTTEC  Our employees have spoken. Our purpose, team, and company culture are amazing and our  Great Place to Work  certification in India says it all! Our recruitment hub is open for walk-in applicants from Monday to Friday, between 10:30 am and 4 pm. Visit TTEC Mumbai at 403 & 404, Nesco IT Park. If you're considering relocation, we also provide virtual interviews. What Youll be Doing   Do you have a passion for helping others and giving them peace of mind? In this role, youll will act as the customers' first point of contact, ensuring their experience is delightful and productive. You will demonstrate confidence in making quick, accurate decisions, using independent judgment to address unfamiliar customer needs. Building and maintaining great customer relationships will be a key aspect of your responsibilities, along with determining when inquiries should be escalated. Your goal will be to provide timely and effective resolution of customer issues, exceeding customer satisfaction goals. During a Typical Day, Youll Answer incoming communications from customers Connect and resolve issues with customers using via verbal & written communication What You Bring to the Role 1 year or more of related customer service experience in banking, financial or account management processes. Supportive of your career and professional development An inclusive culture and community minded organization where giving back is encouraged A global team of curious lifelong learners guided by our company values Relocation assistance to Mumbai available Competitive base wage plus performance bonus opportunities And we have a healthy benefits package based on your position that could include PTO, tuition reimbursement, health and wellness incentives Great English written & verbal communication skills including grammar and spelling   What You Can Expect Supportive of your career and professional development  An inclusive culture and community minded organization where giving back is encouraged  A global team of curious lifelong learners guided by our company values  Base wage starts between  30,000 to 41,000 INR per month , with additional performance bonus opportunities. And we have a healthy benefits package based on your position that could include PTO, tuition reimbursement, health and wellness incentives  Must be able to work on a rotating schedule and weekends/holidays if needed. A Bit More About Your Role    Were committed to ensuring you have the skills and support to be successful in your role throughout your career. From your first day in training, through individualized webcam-enabled, engagement and coaching, on into 1000s of free courses to support your career growth wherever that may take you. And we know that you bring with you the one necessary ingredient that cant be taught  a caring and supportive nature that will shine through as you help customers. Our TTEC community is here for you as one dynamic, global family.  You'll report to Team Lead. You'll contribute to the success of the customer experience and the overall success of the team.

column2: Greetings of the day Our reputed MNC client in Gurgaon is Hiring !! Position:  Sr Associate Location: Gurgaon Sec 49 Shift: -  UK Shift (12:30 PM- 9:30 PM)   Work Mode: WFO for 5-6 Months in rotational shift for training after that Hybrid mode Roles and Responsibilities :-   JOB PURPOSE - As a Call handler in the organization,( Customer Services) you will be an integral part of our Compliance Team, you will be 1st line of contact for our clients, responsible for ensuring timely checks on guards, control and monitoring security activities, maintaining and sharing information on customer complaints with relevant stakeholder. Candidate must be fine with rotational UK shift and weekend working. Accountabilities - Key Role & Responsibilities  First line of contact for our clients.- Receiving Inbound calls from customers and handling their requests  Making quick and accurate choices following strict security protocols  Making and receiving calls to ensure staff are on site.  Logging complaints, incidents and issues via the relevant forms and handing over when required.  Reviewing call monitor and coaching officers the book on process if not using automated system and likewise for tablet booking on  Reviewing emails and passing on to relevant departments as and when needed  Reactive to situations such as management engagement from customer complaints SKILLS AND KNOWLEDGE Essential:  Experience in providing excellent customer service.  Excellent communication skills with problem solving attitude.  Ability to show patience and consideration towards customers via telephone.  Customer oriented, genuinely passionate about customers' security and safety.  Ability to multitask effectively whilst keeping a high level of service quality.  Proactive and able to follow strict protocols accurately.  Accurate data capture and typing skills.  Good to have knowledge of applications like Time Gate  Good IT and Microsoft Office skills.  A selfless team player. Desirable:  Previous experience in a compliance or administrative role.  Familiarity with security industry operations.  Experience with data analysis and reporting tools.  Understanding of GDPR and data protection principles. Educational Qualification/ Experience  Should be strong in Administration or Customer Service.  Must be a Graduate with good command over English Language For quick response kindly share your updated CV on  alvita@v3staffing.in

SENIOR SERVICE EXECUTIVE Reporting To?  - Team Leader About Us -   matrimony.com provides both matchmaking and wedding related services through websites, mobile sites and mobile applications and is also complemented by 120+ company owned retail outlets. column1: Customer Support Executive
column2: Responsibilities: Handle Inbound Calls: Respond to customer inquiries, troubleshoot issues, and provide information in a professional and friendly manner. Problem Resolution: Effectively address and resolve customer concerns, escalating issues when necessary to ensure a swift resolution. Product Knowledge: Develop a deep understanding of our products and services to assist customers with queries and provide accurate information. Quality Assurance: Ensure that all interactions meet or exceed quality standards and adhere to company policies and procedures. Documentation: Maintain accurate and detailed records of customer interactions and transactions. Continuous Improvement: Actively participate in training sessions and seek opportunities for self-improvement to enhance overall performance. Team Collaboration: Collaborate with team members and other departments to share insights, and best practices, and contribute to a positive working environment. Customer Satisfaction: Strive to achieve high levels of customer satisfaction through effective communication and problem-solving skills. Requirements: Previous experience in a customer support role, preferably in a voice-based environment. Strong communication skills with the ability to articulate information clearly and concisely. Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to think on your feet. Empathy and patience when dealing with customer concerns. Familiarity with CRM systems and basic computer skills. Flexibility to work in a dynamic and fast-paced environment. Willingness to work in shifts, including weekends and holidays if required. Note: Speaking in English, Hindi is a must Preferred Qualifications: Bachelors degree or equivalent work experience. Regional (South Indian) language proficiency is a plus.

Address patient concerns and complaints with empathy, striving for prompt resolution and escalate complex issues to the Patient Services Manager as needed. Maintain accurate and detailed records of patient interactions, appointments, and relevant information  Adhere to established quality standards for call handling and customer service. Preferred candidate profile Minimum educational qualification of Bachelor's degree. Excellent communication skills in English and Hindi. Proven customer service experience, preferably in a healthcare or service-oriented environment. Proficient in using call center software and hospital information systems.

column1: US Mortgage Tax Process Specialist
column2: Immediate Joiners Preferred!   Exciting Opportunity for a US Mortgage Tax Process Specialist! Are you a seasoned professional with a knack for US mortgage tax processes? Are you ready to take on a dynamic role where your expertise can shine? Look no further! We're on the hunt for a talented US Mortgage Tax Process Specialist  to join our team. Why Choose Us?   Immediate Impact : Hit the ground running and make a difference from day one in our collaborative environment. Challenging Environment :  Dive into the fascinating world of US mortgage tax processes and tackle complex challenges daily. Cutting-Edge Tools :  Utilize top-notch tools like NertOnline to streamline your workflow and maximize efficiency. Meaningful Impact  : Your contributions will directly impact our organization's success and the satisfaction of our clients. Continuous Growth   :  Stay ahead of the curve with ongoing training and development opportunities in a supportive environment. Collaborative Spirit   :  Join a team of passionate professionals who value collaboration, innovation, and excellence. About the Role : As a US Mortgage Tax Process Specialist, you'll play a pivotal role in managing and executing tax processes across all states in the US, with a special emphasis on Pennsylvania (PA), Texas (TX), New York (NY), and Massachusetts (MA). Your responsibilities will include: Tax Calling with Tax Collectors:  Engage in effective communication with tax collectors to obtain necessary information and resolve any discrepancies. Utilize NertOnline:  Leverage cutting-edge tools like NertOnline to efficiently gather tax values for mortgage properties. Regulatory Compliance:  Ensure compliance with tax regulations and processes across various states, ensuring accuracy and timeliness. Internal Collaboration:  Work closely with internal teams to streamline processes, share insights, and support organizational objectives Requirements : Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, or related field.  Proven track record in US mortgage tax processes, particularly in PA, TX, NY, and MA.  Familiarity with NertOnline or similar tools is highly desired.  Stellar communication skills and impeccable attention to detail.  Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment and juggle multiple tasks with finesse. Please Note :  This role requires on-site work; remote arrangements are not available.  Transportation (CAB) and nightshift allowances are not provided. Perks and Benefits: Competitive salary package with performance bonuses. Comprehensive healthcare coverage for you and your family. Ample opportunities for career growth and advancement.  Vibrant and inclusive work culture that celebrates diversity. Ready to Make Your Mark ? If you're eager to propel your career to new heights and make a meaningful impact,  we want to hear from you! Don't miss out on this exciting opportunity to join our team as a US Mortgage Tax Process Specialist.  Apply now and embark on a rewarding journey with us!
